cause.description:
Incorporated January 10, 1990, KSDS was the first program in the 70-year history of guide dogs in America and the 30-year history of service dogs to provide both of these types of canine assistance from within the same facility.
KSDS assistance dog “teams” consist of the highly-trained dog and the person who is visually impaired or physically disabled. The cost for each team placement is estimated at $15,000. Today KSDS has working teams in 30 states and puppy raisers in 10 states.
KSDS has provided people with disabilities more than $4 million in product and services since November of 1991. As a non-profit organization, KSDS prides itself that 96 cents of every dollar donated goes toward placing assistance dogs.
1. Guide dogs assist people who are visually impaired
2. Service dogs assist people who are physically disabled
3. Social dogs are trained to work with professionals in many areas
4. KSDS is fully accredited by Assistance Dogs International
5. To find out more about KSDS, visit www.KSDS.org
cause.mission: Promote the independence and inclusion of individuals with disabilities as fully participating and contributing members of their communities and society.
cause.name: KSDS, Inc.
